definition: board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: When I'd go out with the dinghy, manta ray would escort me, dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 當我划着小舢板出海時，蝠鱝和海豚會爲我護航。

sentences.english: When did the first junk transporting immigrants from China arrive in Singapore ?
sentences.chinese: 第一艘運送中國移民的舢板哪年到達新加坡？

sentences.english: It came from one last sampan approaching the docks.
sentences.chinese: 答聲從最後一條駛近碼頭的舢板上傳來。

sentences.english: Sometimes we can see schools of fish pass by the sampan.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們可以看到成羣的魚兒從舢板旁邊遊過。

sentences.english: In my mind's eye, I can see the old sailing junks coming into the harbor on a windy evening.
sentences.chinese: 回想起舊時的大舢板船在晚風中駛進港口的情景。

sentences.english: Howard said that he would not hire a sampan.
sentences.chinese: 霍華德說他不再租舢板了。

definition: sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
